candidates.title: Fix issue with multiple containment relations being tested on an entity.
candidates.body: Use a DFS strategy for testing multiple types of relationships.

candidates.title: Version bump dependencies and package v to 2.0.3
candidates.body:
### Changes Made
#### Dependency Updates:
* Bumped package version to 2.0.3.
* Upgraded several dependencies in `Cargo.toml` and `Cargo.lock`:
  * `chrono` updated to 0.4.41.
  * `chrono-tz` updated to 0.10.3.
  * `criterion` updated to 0.5.1.
* Updated `find_timezone` error handler in `iana.rs` to handle `chrono_tz::ParseError`

### Testing
Verified that the project builds successfully with the updated dependencies.
Confirmed that the updated dependencies do not introduce breaking changes.
### Additional Notes
To the best of my knowledge these updates are backward-compatible and do not introduce breaking changes to the public API.

candidates.title: Bugfix/stk 3355 filter indirect has
candidates.body:
Currently this haystack filter fails...

```
siteRef->site and equip
```

There's a bug in the filter lexer that incorrectly creates this instead...

```
siteRef->site->equip
```

I think this bug has always been present in `libhaystack`. I've added more unit and integration tests to further test all bases. I've also done the rust upgrade, update and any clippy fixes.

candidates.title: Feature/stk 3020 upgrade haystack 4
candidates.body:
A long overdue upgrade of haystack core to make it up to date with the latest haystack standard.

Please see these proposals that have now been implemented (except https://project-haystack.org/forum/topic/937)...

This [proposal](https://project-haystack.org/forum/topic/940) has these sub-proposals that have now been implemented...

[935](https://project-haystack.org/forum/topic/935): simplify how choices work for the common case to so that they work like all other tags
[936](https://project-haystack.org/forum/topic/936): redesign how choices work for the complicated specialization use case via a new design pattern using the of tag
[938](https://project-haystack.org/forum/topic/938): finalize the question mark inference operator in filter syntax
[939](https://project-haystack.org/forum/topic/939): remove the equipFunction taxonomy until we learn more

Please note this proposal has not been implemented as the changes haven't yet made it into the main haystack-defs repo...

[937](https://project-haystack.org/forum/topic/937): redesign ref of (domain/referent of the relationship) to use filters and eliminate the fluid-xxx def explosion

Overall the main biggest changes are...

- Reworked choices (minor).
- Refactor how defs are used in the automated tests.
- Reworked relationship haystack filter query.
- Using latest version of Rust with all clippy recommendations implemented. @hecsalazarf please take a look at these changes. It's been a while since I've coded in Rust and I've lost a little confidence when it comes to use of life times.
- Detect haystack filter parser fragments. It seems like not all of a filter was being parsed properly and some error cases where being missed.

Please note, when we release this change, I'll make it a new major version since it relies on a newer version of haystack defs.

candidates.title: STK-2259: add dis support
candidates.body:
Adds general display name calculation support.

The implementation attempts to handle `dis` calculation as efficiently as possible using `Cow` and a lazily cached regular expression.

I've also updated the dependencies and fixed some `clippy` issues.

candidates.title: Add visitor to haystack filter processing
candidates.body:
An implementation of the Visitor pattern for a haystack filter's AST nodes.

Useful for working with a parsed haystack filter AST.

candidates.title: Update dependencies and fix some issues uncover by newer lint rules
candidates.body:
Add default derive for primitive types that where missing it.
Fix the versioning requirements for dateTime so that it requires the 'timezone-db' where it needs to work with timezone data.
Update to the latest deps.
Simplify some of the code base by following clippy  suggestions.

candidates.title: Enable a more granular feature selection
candidates.body:
Enables option to use the units or timezone types independently of the haystack related types.

One use case would be third party using just the units database.

candidates.title: Ignore the "ver" meta entry when decoding from JSON
candidates.body:
Ignore the "ver" meta entry when decoding from JSON

Fixes issue https://github.com/j2inn/libhaystack/issues/10

candidates.title: Fix wee-alloc security issue
candidates.body:
As reported here https://github.com/j2inn/libhaystack/security/dependabot/3 wee-alloc dependency is not maintained, and the preferred allocator is the standard one for Wasm targets.

Also fixed some lint issues with Rust 1.64.0

candidates.title: Updated the unit database
candidates.body:
Separate the unit generation tool from the main source code.

Refactor some parsing code to eliminate duplication and some other nits.

candidates.title: Implement filtering using ref lists
candidates.body:
https://project-haystack.org/doc/docHaystack/Filters

Optimize the existing filter resolver

Add more unit-tests for filtering

candidates.title: Update dependencies and fix the clippy warnings

chosen_pr.title: Version bump dependencies and package v to 2.0.3
chosen_pr.body:
### Changes Made
#### Dependency Updates:
* Bumped package version to 2.0.3.
* Upgraded several dependencies in `Cargo.toml` and `Cargo.lock`:
  * `chrono` updated to 0.4.41.
  * `chrono-tz` updated to 0.10.3.
  * `criterion` updated to 0.5.1.
* Updated `find_timezone` error handler in `iana.rs` to handle `chrono_tz::ParseError`

### Testing
Verified that the project builds successfully with the updated dependencies.
Confirmed that the updated dependencies do not introduce breaking changes.
### Additional Notes
To the best of my knowledge these updates are backward-compatible and do not introduce breaking changes to the public API.
